Additional forms: Also MLTac-acroprickly. (If the root really belongs together with Gondi*ac-'to cut', cf. also MLTasye'to chisel', DEDR 46).

Word: aṛknā "to knead, shampoo by squeezing from place to place"
Additional forms: Also MLTaṛketo thrust or wedge in.

Meaning: any leguminous plant or eatable greens.

Notes: The PND ending is impossible to determine (the suffixes do not match in Kurukh and Malto).

Word: aḍnā "to furnish (a drum) with skin, cover it with leather, (birds or bees) construct a nest or honeycomb, stop stubbornly where one is (a naughty child, intrepid combatants, etc.)"
Additional forms: Also MLTaṛatreto hinder
Notes: The epenthetic vowel in Malto seems to point to an original *-ṛ- (since the inlaut clusterḍris not prohibited in Malto).

Word: aṭṭnā "to spread out upon the ground something folded or rolled up, dispose coins on the ground in close heaps (for counting or a big payment), construct, make"
Additional forms: Also MLTaṭpobedding.
Also KURakrārnāto germinate, shoot, sprout (although [Pfeiffer:168] suggests borrowing from IA, cf. HJ. ãkurā 'sprout', etc.).
Notes: Inlaut-kh-in Kurukh is provisionally traced back to PNDR*-G-; normally a phonetic sequence like-khu-is not met in Kurukh, therefore the reconstruction is quite arbitrary (even if the root is most probably of PDR origin).

Word: ayaŋg "mother (without explicit reference to the children)"
Additional forms: Also KURayōmother (iŋgyō,niŋgyō,taŋgyōmy, thy [his, her, their] mother); MLTijjothy or your mother;tehohis, her, or their mother.
(?) Also KURlātāhole, cavity, den.
Also (?) KURlayākoyāmoving or waling listlessly (as though the limbs had no strength);laikoyOrnāto move the limbs in a negligent, languid fashion as though deficient in strength or manliness.
Notes: The Malto form may not belong here.

Meaning: to laugh, laugh at, mock, seduce
Additional forms: Also KURalkhānakhrnāto laugh together, have unlawful intercourse;alkhābanʔnājoking relations; MLTalqroperson addicted to laughter.

Meaning: to clean grains from minor rubbish by shaking gently with the hand
Additional forms: Also KURalrārnā(grains mixed with straw bits, etc.) undergo the process of cleaning; to be restless, agitated, fret, behave feverishly.

Meaning: water in which rice has been cooked

Word: ā̃ṛsnā "to reach, arrive at, come, overtake, hear about"
Additional forms: Also KURā̃ṛsrnāto be within reach;ā̃ṛstārnāto be brought up to a certain place; MLTan_ṛstreto cause to arrive, convey.

Word: ambnā "to let go, set free, send away, give up, pardon, leave a place"
Additional forms: Also KURambādon't!; MLTambadon't!
Also KURtaŋgṛī(his, her, or their) younger sister.

Word: aŋgal aŋgal "with one's mouth open (in surprise)"
Additional forms: Also KURaŋglnā,aŋglaʔānāto gape, open the mouth wide, be open; MLTaŋg̣loopen-mouthed.

Notes: Obviously an expressive formation, but possibly from an historically solid PDR root.

Meaning: to climb, mount an animal, rise (as sun, moon, stars), rise in pitch (as a drum), get puffed up, (eyes) are turned up before death; (argas) to make climb, lift, haul up, take upon one's shoulders, lay a burden on, begin, raise, increase
Additional forms: Also KURargtaʔānā,argaʔānāto make climb, lift up, etc.; MLTargtreto lift, raise.
Notes: A good example on the differentiation of the 'active' and 'concealed'-j-in Kurukh verbal stems: the -j-preterite and simple preterite stems respectively reflect the unmarked and the causative meanings. In Malto the "concealed"-j-is implicitly indicated by the stop-g-(*arg-nāwould have yielded*arg̣-e).
See KR-17. In DEDR the Malto form is tentatively compared with Tam.ayir'to suspect', etc., but it is hardly reasonable to separate it from Kurukhasrnāto which it corresponds perfectly.

Word: assgnā "to adhere, stick, hold to or together, attach oneself to, fit, (tongue) to be unable to utter distinctly"
Additional forms: Also KURassAgtaʔānāto glue, paste or make otherwise adhere; MLTasgreto adhere;asg̣eto paste on, make of two things one.

Word: axrnā "to warm oneself (by the fire, in the sun)"
Additional forms: Also MLTawg̣reto bask in the sun, warm oneself at a fire.
Notes: The reconstruction is provisional (Malto -w- could turn out to be secondary).

Meaning: to spread throughout, pervade, be felt, tasted in every portion of the mass prepared (of spices and ferments)

Additional forms: Also KURajjīgrandmother.

Word: ādnā "to recognize by feeling with the fingers, know by touch"

Meaning: to spread out in the sun for drying

Word: axnā (axcas, akkhas) "to know, realize, experience, mistake for"
Additional forms: Also KURaxkā,akhkāknowledge, experience; MLTāg̣reto get accustomed to.
Notes: The lack of vowel length in Kurukh is probably secondary (possibly due to the influence of nominal derivatives where the vowel was shortened before clusters). Inlaut -g-, -g̣- in Malto and -x- in Kurukh point to PNDR  *-q-  (PNDR*āq-nā>  Kurukhax-nā, PNDR pret.*āq-as>  Kurukhakkh-aswith the regular gemination *-q- > *-qq- > -kkh-). The preterite form in Malto - with gemination, no less - is unclear.

Additional forms: Also KURālasan adult male person, husband, friend, servant, soldier.

Notes: В малто необъяснимое сокращение долготы. Возможно, форму следует реконструировать с кластером (*alC-), обусловившим сокращение гласного.

Additional forms: Also MLTam-amreto water (as the mouth);amsrowaterish.

Word: ānnā "to cause pain by being pressed against the skin (as gravel on the road, a knot in the mat)"
Additional forms: MLT may not belong here.

Meaning: goad, pointed end of goad, point of lance or stick
thin, attenuated, reduced in strength, slender, slim
Additional forms: Also KURācnāto turn out tihn, grow thinner.
Also MLTātg̣en ēreto divine by looking at a leaf;ātg̣oa diviner.
Notes: Vowel shortening in Kurukh may be due to the consonant cluster.
Реконструкция условна (нетривиальная фонетическая структура в обоих языках).

Additional forms: Also MLTbagḍ-poṭicalf of the leg.

Word: bakkā "claws of a crab, forceps, shears"

bāynā (bāycas) "to respect, keep on a footing of reserve with (elder brothers with younger brothers' wives, elder sisters with younger sisters' husbands, man with wife's elder sisters, woman with husband's elder brothers)"
Additional forms: Also KURbāenā xoenāto shun; MLTbāc-naqpoa relative by law.

Word: bēʔenā (biccyas) "used as an auxiliary; to be, stay, remain"
Notes: Нерегулярный случай с нетривиальным соответствием (малто -h-!).

Meaning: to get out of shape by expanding sidewise or falling under one's own weight (as an earthen vessel when unbaked, a mud wall, a ball of wax, a heap of manure when very wet)

Additional forms: Also MLTbēkbēkreto taste saltish.

Word: birxnā (refl. and pass. birxrnā) "to help to some more at meals, cook some accessory ingredient along with the main article of food, mix several kinds of seeds (esp. for sowing)"
Additional forms: Also KURbirxīmixture of rice and marwa used in rice-beer brewing; MLTbirg̣reto be mixed, be joined, keep company with.

Word: boŋgnā "to run, run away, leave a place for good, keep clear of"
Additional forms: Also KURboŋgtaʔānāto make run, carry about or off with great speed, lose (by death or otherwise); MLTbon_g̣treto cause to run, carry away.

Word: xerrnā (xirryas) "to introduce lengthwise by gradual pushing, insert, stick into or behind"
currā "vegetal sugar, sweet juice which drops from mango flowers or from the new leaves of sāl tree"

Meaning: projecting point on a hill or mountain, peak, crag

Additional forms: Also KURcerontā,certāof yesterday; MLTcewtiyesterday's.
Also MLTcircospurs of a cock.
Notes: Только форма *cīrc- позволяет нам объяснить нерегулярность рефлексов (выпадение -c- в курух и сокращение долготы в малто); впрочем, причиной подобных нерегулярностей может быть очевидная звукоподражательность данного корня).

Additional forms: Also KURī̃jnāto clean the nose;ī̃jrnāto clean one's own nose.

Word: curxnā (caus. curxtaʔānā) "to pour, let fall in drops; let water in or out through a hole or crevice, leak, pass (as water, grains, etc.) through a crack, fissure or aperture in a vessel, ooze, fall in drops. trickle, fall in numbers"
Additional forms: Also MLTcurg̣treto tap a tree
Also MLTcumqrēseto sound with the lips in calling animals.

Word: carmnā (Tiga caṛmnā) "to become flaccid, flabby (as a plant cut off from the stem), feel or look weak, enervated (through heat, exertion, illness, cares)"
Additional forms: Also KURcarmtaʔānāto weaken, debilitate, unnerve.

Word: caṭkaʔānā, caṭgaʔānā "to slap in the face"
Additional forms: Also KURcaṭcaṭrnā'to crackle, give forth a series of small explosions (as fire or loud slaps)'
Also KURcaktaʔānāto cut in slices;ceglāchip, splinter; MLTcakaa slice;cagjeto chop up (as meat).

Notes: Отсутствие материала в малто не дает нам определить характер ПСД фонемы - *ḍ или *ṛ.

Additional forms: Also KURīmnāto be deteriorated or destroyed by white ants.

Word: dagnā "to light, set fire to, burn (tr.)"
talAkhnā "to pull off, strip, peel, decorticate"
Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)talkhnāto sever, separate.

Notes: Начальное ḍ- в малто - по ассимиляции со срединным ретрофлексным. На основании нетривиального соответствия курух -ḍy- - малто -ṭ- мы условно постулируем ПСД *-ḍy-.

Additional forms: Also KURṭōṛō̃a pole with an iron hook or branch curved down to one extremity;tūṛsīa variety of the native rake orṭōṛō̃; (Bleses)ṭōṛōa long stick with an iron hook.

Word: elkhrnā "to go down (sun, moon, stars), be well past the meridian"

Meaning: to remain over, be in excess, be passed over, escape
Additional forms: Also KUReŋgrkāwhat remains over and above, excess, surplus, remainder.

Additional forms: Also KURēxrnā(heat of day) abates;ēxtaʔānāto cool (tr.); MLTēg̣treto make cool.

Additional forms: Also KURībīrīat this moment (previously mentioned);idā,isan,hisanhere;istīfrom here;idimjust at present;idnāthis year;īgetherefore;ijgōin this direction;innūin this direction, by this means,ittrā,hittrāid., hither;iũndā,iū̃rā,iū̃rū,iū̃as nuch or many as;iū̃ŋgēso, therefore;iyyā,hiyyāover here, in this village or country;ennēsuch as this; MLTīw,īwethese objects or circumstances (previously mentioned);ithi,ihin_,inda,in_hihere!;indeki,īnki,īnle,īn_y,in_ylethus;īneto do thus;inohere;inondso much;inonnoby this time;inornow;īṭithis place.

Additional forms: Also KURīcnā(īcyas),īsnā(īsyas) to pluck (an ear of Indian corn); MLTic-qoṭeto jerk, shake off;icgreto come off, get loose;īceto louse.

Meaning: to be night-blind, to be very dark

Word: ānnā "to say, tell, salute as, point out, designate"

Additional forms: Also KURhērnāto be tied, be put in bonds, be united together;ēpstring, cord, rope; MLTēpufibres of a wild plant of which cord is made.

Additional forms: Also KURnē nēwho; MLTnērith/nēth,nērerwhich man, woman, thing.
Notes: One of the three NDR interrogative bases, serving for masc. and fem. forms of the pronoun 'what'; see also *ek-, *endr-.

Meaning: to swallow (any thickish liquid), drink (e.g. broth, rice-water, medicine)
Additional forms: Also KURxappāleech;habkāa bite;habkaʔānāto bite.

Meaning: to eat; to derange the stomach
bitter, pungent, highly salted, harsh (fig.), changed to bitterness (of feelings)

Word: xall "field, piece of land suitable for tillage"

Additional forms: Also KURkappar ērnāto feel, touch.

Notes: Anlaut reconstruction unclear.

Additional forms: Also MLTqāweto speak, whisper or sound (as the leaves of a tree);qāwe-naqeto converse;qawseto jingle, warble, sound (as rushing water).
Also KURxā̃srnāto scratch oneself

Additional forms: Also KURxāpusguardian, keeper, watchman.

Meaning: to bear fruit, be produced (after the manner of a fruit), come forth
Additional forms: Also KURxańjkā,xańjpāfruit, effect, result;xēnāunripe, raw, half-cooked, unboiled (of water), green, verdant, wet; MLTqanjpefruit;qēneraw, green, unripe.

Word: xāynā (xayyas) "to lose moisture, dry up, evaporate, lose flesh, waste away"
Additional forms: Also KURxaixairnāto become quite dry, parched;xaidnā,xaidaʔānāto make dry, desiccate (by exposing to the sun, fire, or the air); (Hahn)xaikādry, dried up, withered; MLTqeyreto be boiled, be hot;qeytreto boil, make hot.
Also KUR (Hahn)xārnāto make a course for the flowing of water.

Meaning: to be pleasant to the eye, be of good effect, suit well

Additional forms: Also KURxē̃sblood; anger; MLTqēsloreddish;qēsublood;qēsolāreto redden (as the eyes, face, or fruit when ripening).
Also MLTqēreto shave;qērtreto be shaved;qērubarber.

Word: kīdnā, kīdʔānā "to allow or invite one to lie down for rest or sleep, put to bed (a child, a sick person), lay in the grave"

Notes: Инлаутный согласный не определяется (как в курух, так и в малто существует возможность ассимиляции с анлаутным *q-).

Word: xodOxnā (xudxyā) "to be reduced to pulp by unskilful cooking; to get discouraged, despair; (xodxas) to reduce (by excessive cooking) to a soft uniform mass, cook until they fall to pieces; to worry, deprive of self-confidence, dishearten"
Meaning: to reduce to pulp; to overheat
Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)xodxnāto burn (tr.) by overheating.

Meaning: boy, lad, young man, male child
Additional forms: Also KURkukoygirl, lass, young woman;koyabbreviative form of the vocativekukoy.

Notes: Although the root is found only in Kurukh, the reconstruction on the NDR level is certain because of the derivative *kot-g-, present both in Kurukh and Malto

Additional forms: Also KURxoṭrnāto be broken; MLTqoṭreto be broken;qoṭureto knock or dash against.

Word: xōr "leaf-bud, new leaves, fresh and tender leaves of vegetables"

Additional forms: Also MLTqōrtreto supply or provide for abundantly.

Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)khīū, (Grignard)khiʔūmortal; MLTkeypedead;keyumortal;keytreto let die, suppose someone dead;kagleto die.

Word: kē̃snā (kī̃syas) "to winnow with up-and-down jerks of the shovel-basket"
Additional forms: Also KURkē̃tErwinnowing basket; MLTkētnuwinnowing basket.

Word: kōrnā "to enter, go in, (fever) seizes, be readmitted among"
Additional forms: Also MLTkortreto let enter, thrust in.

Word: kuṛnā (kuṭṭas) "to grow warm, become hot, be heated; cook (tr.) on live embers, bake on an open fire"
Additional forms: Also MLTkuṛnareto be hot or warm;kuṛniwarm, hot.

Word: kumʔnā "to take and carry on head, make oneself responsible for, confess, be pregnant as result of a fault"

Meaning: to be nervous and fidgety (as an animal overfed and left without work), be in rut, grow fond of a thing through habit, (Hahn) be intoxicated

Word: mãyã "malt prepared for making beer, malt refuse, beer in its preparatory stage"
Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)māyā,mā̃yān_arrack made of rice.
Notes: A very complicated case. The PDR root is *maj-; however, in order to explain both the nasalization in Kurukh and the strange form in Malto, we have to suppose at least a specific suffix (probably modifying the original meaning 'intoxication' into 'intoxicating beverage'). And only a unique sound combination, like *-jnc-, could account for the unique correspondence Kur. -ãy- - Mlt. -ēc-. If this is the case, then in Kurukh *majnc- > *mãjc- > *mãj-, while in Mlt. *majnc- > *mēnc- > *mēc-. The problem is: what is the nature of this *-nc-?

Additional forms: Also KURmalānot, no;malnānot to be (so);malʔānot (when the negation falls on one single word which is being opposed to another word); no;malkādeprived of, lacking;mal-(pastmall-) to be not.

Also MLTmargomale deer.

Word: maitā, maitlā, maīyyantā, maŋyantā "uppermost, topmost, placed above, higher, highest; the higher regions, heaven"
Additional forms: Also KURmaitantācoming from above;maitīfrom above;maitlēfrom the top, from above;mańyā̃on, upon, above, overhead;meccāhigh, tall, lofty;mēn-ērnāto look up, raise the eyes; MLTmecgeheight;mecgetreto raise, lift up;mectensuperficially;men_yeup, above;mēmereto look upwards (ēreto see);mēmetreto lift up (as the countenance).

Notes: В малто нерегулярное сокращение долготы.

Word: mulUxnā (mulxyas), munUxnā "to sink, walk or fall into, be submerged, founder, go to the bottom, (sun or moon) sets, get hopelessly lost"
Additional forms: Also KURmulxaʔānāto precipitate, plunge, let sink, submerge, engulf, wreck, ruin;mulUxtaʔānāto cause (somebody or something) to be sunk through the agency of a third person, swallow up; MLTmulg̣reto dive, be dipped in.

Word: mōxnā (pass.refl. mōxrnā) "to eat (anything except cooked rice)"
Additional forms: Also KURmōxtaʔānāto cause or allow someone to eat.
Also KURmojOxnā,mosgaʔānā,mosOgnāto create smoke, smoke anything, fumigate;mōjxOrnā,mosgOrnāto smoke, emit fumes; MLTmog̣jeto fumigate;mog̣treto cause to smoke;mog̣arecharcoal, soot.

Word: muccnā "to close door or lid, shut"
Additional forms: Also KURmuccōa fishing basket;musUgnāto envelop, wrap in, pack into a bundle; MLTmusgeto pack up, tie into a bundle;musgreto be closed.

Word: munddh, mund "first, ahead of, previous to, before that time, ago"
Additional forms: Also KURmuńjāthe extremity, beginning, headpoint, end; MLTmundotiancient.

Word: murrnā "to thunder, esp. with repeated peals, utter threats, threaten"
Meaning: to thunder; to threaten; to speak
to become perfectly dry, be dried to excess
Additional forms: Also KURmurdaʔānāto dry to the inside, dry to excess;murjhārnāto get quite dry; (Hahn) dry up, wither;murjhaʔānāto scorch, parch.
Also KURmurkārnāto sprain oneself.

Meaning: to deal a heavy blow with the fist
Additional forms: Also KURmuṭgā,muṭkāclenched hand or fist, hammering with the fist;muṭkaʔānāto hit or hammer at with the fist.
Also KUR (Hahn)mukāelbow; (Hahn)mūkā,mūkulknee; MLTmukicubit.
Also KURmūndthree things.

Word: mulnā (refl. mulrnā) "to tie the hair into a chignon"
Additional forms: Also MLTmulutreto gather up another's hair into a cue.

Also KURmurcrnāto get broken, not to come off or out entire;murUknāto abscind, amputate, cut in twain by hacking, cut in small pieces, damage by cutting off a part, mangle, mutilate; MLTmurkreto be cut to pieces

Meaning: to clean by rubbing a little water or a moist cloth on
Additional forms: Also KURnalbrnāto rub oneself with oil; (?)nilIbnāto crease, crumble, crush by rubbing between both hands, rub roughly

Meaning: to dance, skip or jump about, bound up (as running water amidst boulders)
Additional forms: Also MLTlaldeto make to dance, lead about.
Also KUR refl.pass.nanArnā,nantārnā; caus.nantaʔānā;nalAkhwork, action, labour, carrying out, use, efficiency

Word: mãńj "any vegetal poison used for intoxicating and catching fish"
Additional forms: Also MLTmanjrareto be benumbed, be sickly.

Meaning: tidbit (meat, fish, etc.) cooked together with meal to impart relish or flavour to it
to hum, weep and sob loudly so as to attract attention
to soften down, render less acute or vehement, render thinner, reduce in point of stoutness
Additional forms: Also KURnarmārnāto decrease, diminish; abate; (Hahn)narmaʔanāto become less, give way, waste

Meaning: to cause men or cattle to sicken, languish, or die
Additional forms: Also KURnasrnāto be ill or pine away.
Also KURnaibfour (Grignard, used with animals and things; Hahn, indefinite masc. or fem.)

Word: essnā (issyas) "to weave, entwine into a fabric, furnish or adorn any article with net-work or plait-work"

Additional forms: Also maybe MLTnepeforehead, brow.

Meaning: (Hahn) to thresh rice, winnow; (Grignard) tread as paddy, trample, throw down, beat

Additional forms: Also KURnī̃xcārnāto experience a convulsive and somewhat prolonged heaving of the breast, sigh, sob, draw in a long breath; MLTnēg̣ebreath.
Also KUR (Hahn)nirnāto dry up.

Meaning: embers, live coals, wood glowing with fire, brand

Word: ilnā (ilcas/illas) "to get up, rise to one's feet"
Additional forms: Also KURijnā(ijjas) to be stationary in an upright position, rise to one's feet, stand on end, stop, halt, pause, maintain a fixed or steady attitude, persist, persevere;ildnā,ildaʔānā,iltaʔānā,ijtaʔānāto erect, set up, rest against; MLTildeto make to stand.
Notes: The protoform of the infinitive was*ilcnā(maybe*iljnā).

Word: nīndnā, nindrnā "to be filled, (river) is full, (bees) spread over (body)"
Additional forms: Also KURnindnāto fill, pour in up to the brim; MLTnindg̣reto be filled

Word: nollnā "to draw out (with a semicircular motion), scoop out as paddy with a winnowing basket, soup with a ladle"
Additional forms: Also KURnollōfishing net, much like the English butterfly net.

Meaning: to swallow without chewing, gulp hastily, devour

Additional forms: Also MLTnunjuwreto be hurt.
Also KURnō̃ṛhOrnāto wash oneself, one's own hands, feet, etc.; MLTnōḍreto wash one's hands and feet.

Meaning: to swallow without chewing, gulp hastily, devour
to shake, cause to oscillate, esp. up and down
Additional forms: Also KURnukrūshaky, tottering;nuktaʔānāto cause another to shake something; MLTnukreto swing, rock, be shaken

Word: nūxnā, nū̃khnā "to bow (the head), keep down (the eyes); silence, defeat, put down"

Meaning: to hide, conceal, screen from sight, veil, mask off
Additional forms: Also KURnūxrnāto hide oneself, be kept secret;nulUgnāto insert a thing into another by a sliding push, thrust or slip into or under lengthwise;nulgUrnāto enter into or under, head foremost, creep into; MLTnuḍg̣reto hide (intr.), disappear;lulqeto thrust in;lulqreto disappear (as in a crowd or jungle);lulg̣reto hide oneself

Word: oṛOgnā (oṛg-/oṛgc-), oṛgaʔānā "to press, flatten, trample out of shape, kill by crushing throttle"
Additional forms: Also KURoṛOknā(uṛUkhyas) to crush out of shape, cause to wither, kill (plant); MLToṛgreto become blunt
Also KUR refl.hoʔornā; pass.hōtārnā; caus.hōtaʔānā.

Word: okknā (ukkyas) "to sit down, seat oneself, alight, perch, hold a session, come to a standstill, acquire steadiness, reside"
Additional forms: Also KURokkrnāto sit down in order to breathe or recover oneself;oktaʔānāto invite to sit down, give firmness to, settle; MLToketeto sit down, settle;oktreto place, put down, make to sit
Also KURōlāresting-place of a wild beast, hiding-place or lair.
Also KURōndkitāat one time, once; MLT-onontione by one (things)

Word: opnā (refl.pass. oprnā) "to wet, soak (with a view to softening and preparing for work)"

Additional forms: Also KURotOx, fem.utxīalone, lonely;orāsariequal, at the same time;ormāall;hormā, fem.hurmīid.; (Hahn)hormar, (Bleses)ormarid. (masc.pl.); MLTorteone man;ortione woman;ortg̣ealone;ortonontione by one (persons);ormeall.

Word: otthā "burden; heavy, difficult, hard to suffer, important"
odnā (oddas) "to kindle a fire by means of straw or shavings"

Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)ōṛēa small bird.
Also KURōgrnāto be swum across, (tank or stream) supports;ōgtaʔānāto make swim, float (trees, etc.)

Word: pāxnā "to expand by main strength, force open"

Additional forms: Also KURpairīmorning; MLTpohpohredawn.

Word: paṛAxnā "to separate or force asunder the two parts of some object previously split, two limbs, etc."
Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)parxnāto split, cleave, rend;parAmnāto bite, separate the two natural halves (of pulse seed) with the handmill (Pfeiffer); MLTparg̣reto be split, rent;parg̣rocracked, rent, a crack, fissure.

Meaning: to talk against one, detract, slander, run one down

Word: paccā "old; former, past (of things just gone)"
Additional forms: Also KURpacbāold, stricken in years; the dead;pacgīold, advanced in years, ancient of olden times;paccnāto grow old; MLTpacgeaged;pacoold (with reference to animals)

Meaning: to ripen, (boil) festers, have a yellowish appearance (as after a prolonged illness)
Additional forms: Also KURpańjkāfruits; MLTpāntreto ripen (tr.), teach manners;panjek,panjekeripe

Word: palknā "to cut lengthwise, split, crack (the earth, a wall), chap (the hands, etc.)"

Meaning: to grow in number, increase in quantity, grow in size or age, prosper, succeed, thrive

Additional forms: Also KURpāb ērnāto wait for (ērnāto see).

Word: pesnā (pett-) "to gather up, pick up, glean, choose, pick out by lifting up"
Additional forms: Also KURpesEgnāto weed, cleanse by removing that which is objectionable.
Also MLTpany-panyreto feel cold;pey-peyreto feel chilly.
Also KURallā-pē̃nflea (allādog).

Meaning: to pour off the water from boiled rice

Additional forms: Also KURpēskācommand, order, precept;perperErnāto prate, prattle, talk with a high-pitched voice; (vessel in which something is cooking) to hum, buzz, sing; (Hahn)perxperxnāto babble, prattle;parparernāto prate, prattle.
Also MLTpethg̣reto burst or break (as a fruit).
Also KURpisnānext year;pistāsubsequent, later, subordinate; MLTpistithe lower.

Meaning: the back of the body behind the shoulders

Word: pellō "female child, female not arrived at puberty, bride or young woman (before she has had children), maidservant"
Additional forms: Also KURpellmaidservant; MLTpelofemale (of plants).

Word: pinnī "aunt (wife of father's younger brother), niece (elder brother's daughter)"

Meaning: to press and bruise, flatten by crushing

Word: porOxnā (purxyas) "to swell as a result of imbibed water"
Additional forms: Also KURborsnāto get moist, become wet;bothnāto plunge or soak into water; MLTporg̣treto soak;porg̣pedamp or moist ground. KUR forms may not belong here because of initial b-; as for Brahui root, correspondences are surely irregular.

Word: poē̃nā (before vowel pońń-, pō̃yy-; past possā) "to fall (of rain)"
Additional forms: Also KURpuỹdnāto pour some water on rice when ready for a meal; MLTputhyeto pour.
Notes: Why notpoʔonāin Kurukh?

Additional forms: Also MLTpog̣lo, inmug-pog̣lowart.
Also KURpolrnā,poltārnāto be rendered impossible, be beyond the strength of;poltaʔānāto prevent one from doing some action; MLTpolg̣reto be impossible;poltreto vanquish, fire out.

Meaning: to swell (as rice put in cold water, as the result of a fall, of an illness)
Additional forms: Also KURpūxkāswelling, abscess;pokpokrnāto puff out, bloat, swell much;pēxpēxrnā,pekpekrnāto swell up; MLTpon_g̣jeto be increased, be abundant;pūg̣eto swell;pūg̣reto be swollen, pout;pūg̣ro,pūg̣ṭoswollen, a boil.

Meaning: half cooked, not sufficiently boiled (of grains only)
to become hoary, grey in hair
Additional forms: Also KUR (Grignard)poṇḍnā(puṇḍyas/poṇḍos) to become hoary, get mouldy or musty.
Also KURputbelōwhite ants' queen.
Also KURpuḍḍnāto be too small or too short for.

Meaning: worm, caterpillar, fleshy larva, esp. of beetle
Additional forms: Also KURpoccnā(puccyas) to engender worms (as a wound, rotten cheese, etc.); rot, fester; MLTposg̣oweevil.

Word: pojjnā (pujjyas) "to wrap (paper, cloth) round some object or person"
Additional forms: Also KURpojjrnā,pojOrnāto coil or twist oneself round some object or person, be folded or wrapt round, involve (of a drapery), suit well; MLTpojg̣reto be wrapped or twisted, be entangled.
Also KURpuỹdnā,puīdnāto bloom, flower; (sun) sets in a glory of purple and gold; MLTpūtheto blossom.
Also KURpundUrnāto pass round one's neck;pūnnecklace; MLTpundeto put on another's neck (a wreath or necklace);pūnunecklace, garland.
Also MLTpūg̣pe,pūpg̣eboiled grain.

Word: saḍḍnā "to emit a sound, ring, clank"
Additional forms: Also KURsaṛāsound, noise.

Word: carrnā "to tear, rend, dilacerate with the teeth, plough for the first time in the year"
Additional forms: Also MLTcartreto cause to cut with scissors.

Meaning: to continue, go on, be current (as coin), wield power, go away, quit, behave
Additional forms: Also KUR.calābaʔānāto set going, guide to a place;calāoff.

Word: caŋgrnā "to itch, be the seat of a titillation"
Additional forms: Also KURcaŋgrtaʔānā'to tickle, titillate, please (as a musical sound)'
Notes: MLT cēql- possibly < *cenql-.

Word: cār "a tree of the reed kind, which grows to a height of 7 or 8 feet (its wood is very hard and serves to make pen-holders and arrow-shafts); arrow-shaft, arrow"
Meaning: a k. of tree from which arrow-shafts are made
around, near, in the vicinity of

Additional forms: Also KURcalxrnāto open (intr.); MLTcalgrotorn asunder.

Word: cāʔanā, cāʔnā (cā̃cas) "to stink, give forth an offensive smell; to smell in general"
Additional forms: Also MLTcen_yroscented, smelling.
Notes: Конечное -c корня реконструируется на основании инфинитива в курух.

Meaning: young plant just piercing the soil, small seedling
Additional forms: Also KURcigyārnāto sprout, shoot, come out.

Word: citī "a tamarind seed with one of its sides rubbed until it has become white"

Meaning: pointed (said of the mouth of animals)

Word: coʔonā (cōcas) "to rise, get up, be built up or erected, rise in the air, in fame, in value, rebel, bulge out, be produced, appear"
Additional forms: Also KURcōdnāto lift up, raise, erect; MLTcoytreto raise up, awake, begin a song.

Word: taknā "to rub or graze in passing, give a very slight knock"
Additional forms: Also KUR refl.pass.takrnāto get a slight knock; MLTtakuwreto be pained or grieved.
Also MLTtareto break (as a stick), injure
Also KURtāgrnāto blow (of the wind); MLTtāgareto wave, undulate, fly with a waving motion as a sherd when thrown.

Word: tān (obl. taŋg-) "refl. pron. of the 3rd pers. himself"

Meaning: ear ornament of metal, shaped like the moon-crescent

Additional forms: Also KUR refl. and. pass.tisgrnā

Word: telnā "to winnow flour so as to separate it from stones or unground grain"

Meaning: to assist a woman in raising a load to her head

Word: tindnā "to put into another person's mouth"

Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)tindīfast, immovable; (Grignard)tiū̃khnāto groan, moan under a violent effort, as when lifting a heavy load, fighting, etc.; (Hahn)tinkhnā,tiū̃xnāto strain, as at stool.

Meaning: to turn on one's heels over a few grains of scalded paddy to see if it has become sufficiently dry to husk, make pirouettes
to have a sweet taste, be a relish for, please

Additional forms: Also MLTtonqrobent.
Notes: Во всех остальных корнях с начальным *ṭ- оно, несомненно, вторично и возникло в результате ассимиляции с инлаутным ретрофлексным; это наводит нас на мысль, что в данном корне запись ṭ- в курух ошибочна (ср. малто, где начальный смычный не ретрофлексный).

Word: toṛsOgnā (tuṛsgyas) "to touch slightly with the foot"

Meaning: to stamp violently with one foot or with both feet (as in jatra dance)

Additional forms: Also KURtumʔtaʔānāto cause one to sneeze.
Also KURdumbhārōsp. of very long hornet;tumbilwasp; MLTtumbṛareblack wasp.
Notes: Вариант с начальным звонким, по-видимому, вторичен.

Word: tundnā "to be poured out, spill, pour into"
Additional forms: Also KURtundrnāto be poured out, be spilt; MLTtundg̣reto be spilt, be shed.
Also KURtuppalxōsaliva, spittle; MLTtupg̣le,tulg̣pespittle.

Word: turdnā "to pass through any narrow aperture, slip through a narrow passage of any form, fall through a hole, ooze out"
Additional forms: Also KURturdaʔānāto pass (a thread, string) through a hole, let pass an animal, help or allow someone to pass through any narrow aperture.
Also MLTturgeto bury the ashes of the dead. Cf. also MLTtun_ga,tun_gṛahollow of a bamboo or bridge, tube, tunnel.

Meaning: to bubble up, gush up or out with force, swell up
to be agitated by the action of heat, boil, be boiled or cooked; be tired up to excitement

Notes: Неясно отсутствие геминации в курух.

Additional forms: Also KURoṛOgnā,oṛgaʔānāto believe, think, fancy, assume ('inside' - 'entrails' - 'heart' - 'mind'???); MLTugliheart, mind;ugleyeto think, wish, care for;uglareto remember;uglatreto remind.
Also KURumulkāurine; MLTumblmurourine (muroid.).
Also KURōnkāthirst;ōntaʔānāto give a meal, make drink; MLTondeto drink, colour, dye.

Word: ujjnā "to have life, reside, become animated, take life"
Additional forms: Also KURujjtaʔānāto keep alive, bring back to consciousness, raise again to life, revive (fire, quarrel); MLTujniliving, alive.
Also KURugtāa plough, ploughshare.
Also KURoṛOknā(uṛUkyas) to strip a tree of its bark; MLTōṛyeto peel, unveil, drive away (as wind does the clouds)

Word: ujgō "uprightness, moral rectitude; adj. straight, upright; (Hahn) straight, right, true, straightforward"
hūs, hūr/hubṛar, hūd, hubṛā "this male, these persons, this female or thing, these things (intermediate between near and far, or close to the person addressed)"
Additional forms: Also KURhūthis;hū̃rā,hū̃dā,hū̃rū,hurūthat much of (shown from some distance), that much (i.e. as much as is with you, or as much as you said);hudā,huiyyā,husanthere (in the centre, or close to you);hujgōin that (intermediate) direction;hunnūby that way;huttrātowards that quarter, on that side (previously mentioned), on your side, in your village or country.

Word: ūdnā "to fix a closed door, shutter, etc. (by a bolt, latch, lock, stay)"
Additional forms: Also KURuddUrnā(uddras),udUrnā(udras) to lean upon a walking-stick;udur-udurēknāto walk leaning upon a stick; MLTūdure(udurya) to lean upon;udutreto prop up (as a screen).

Word: ūrnā "to blow, play upon a wind-instrument, set a fire to, put out (a light), draw (poison by magic insufflations)"
Additional forms: Also MLTūrtreto have exorcisms performed in case of illness.

Word: battnā "(liquids) decrease by evaporation, boiling, percolation"
Additional forms: Also KURbattaʔānāto empty, dry (tr.)

Meaning: to turn (tr.) from a straight line, bend, curve
Additional forms: Also KURbeŋkō,baŋkā'crooked, bent, curved'

Meaning: to dawn, begin to grow light
Additional forms: Also KURbijjtaʔānāto protract till dawn.

Word: baccnā "to snatch away, rob by force, carry off, seize, confiscate"

Additional forms: Also MLTbalebalelarge ones.

Meaning: to perceive as by sniffing, scent, discover or track by the smell
mouth (of man and animal), aperture of a vessel, mouthful
Additional forms: Also KURbaī-muī̃the face.

Meaning: a brownish variety of the magṛī or horned fish

Additional forms: Also KURbālkōyellow; MLTbālkoyellow.

Meaning: to come, arrive, draw near, fall under the perception of the senses or the mind, be forthcoming

Word: bārnā "to fish out (lit. to take out of a liquid any solid object that was plunged into it), bake or fry by dipping for a moment in boiling oil.to gather leaves together (with hand or broom)"
beddnā (biddyas) "to seek, search, get (second wife, concubine), find, discover, want, wish, be about to, be liable to"
Additional forms: Also MLTbeduwreto be married.
Also KURbīṛīsun, time; MLTbiḍeto shoot forth (as rays)

Word: bilcnā "to shine, glitter, sparkle, be conspicuous"
Additional forms: Also KURbilctaʔānāto polish, cause to shine or glitter; be lightning;bilbilrnāto sparkle, twinkle, scintillate;billīlight, that which is a source of light (lamp, candle), flame, mental or moral illumination;belbelrnāto be an albino, have an unusual or morbid whiteness of the skin.

Word: mennā (meńj-) "to hear, listen, obey, question, ask"
Additional forms: Also KURmendnāto tell, inform; MLTmendreto be heard, be rumoured

Meaning: to turn over (tr.), turn round, give back
Additional forms: Also KURānā-biṛdnāto answer, retort.

Word: baĩnā (bańń-), bēnā (bēńń-) "to cover with tiles, thatch, etc."
Notes: Гласный и согласный -s- восстанавливается на основании формы малто; на присутствие носового  недвусмысленно указывает курух (ср. также центрально-дравидийские формы типа колами vēnz-, найки vēnj- и др.; см. также ПСД *mesgā).

Meaning: to disgust with, make sick of, disaffect from
Additional forms: Also KURbirkhārnāto grow disaffected, conceive a disgust for, be sick of

Meaning: to consume to ashes, (man) destroys by fire
Additional forms: If the root really < PDR *vēj- 'hot', then cf. MLTbēru'sun'.
Also KURbelxākingdom;belō,bēlōqueen of white-ants.

Word: bā̃cnā "to throw (a piece of clothing) on someone's shoulders, wrap it around his body"
Additional forms: Also KURbā̃crnāto wear, put on (around oneself, as a mantle), wrap or drape oneself in; MLTbāsreto cover oneself with clothing
Notes: Условно реконструируемое сочетание *-nc-, по-видимому, в малто озвончилось, в курух же дает ожидаемый рефлекс (назализованность предыдущего долгого гласного + c).

Word: bidIgnā "to lay partly bare the contents by violent action upon the covering, tear open, make a rent, make burst or crack by weighing upon"
Additional forms: Also KURbidgrnāto be laid bare, get exposed to view.

Word: bidṛaʔānā (refl. or pass. bidṛārnā) "to scatter about in disorder, spread all over"
Additional forms: Also MLTbiḍretreto disperse.

Word: bicchrnā "to let go (cattle), release (a prisoner), let go, relax one's grip, let loose (as dog), send (policeman after)"

Meaning: to overflow, as leaven when fermenting (Hahn)

Word: cakkhnā (cakkhyas/cakkos, refl. cakkhrnā) "to pierce with a prick, prick, penetrate into, puncture, cause a prickly sensation, experience a prickly sensation; refl. to be tattooed, etc."
Additional forms: Also MLTcaqroworm-eaten roots;caqtreto have the ears bored;caqushooting pains in the stomach.
Notes: Праформа - либо *caq-y-, либо *caG-.

Meaning: (of the rains) to percolate and soak the ground thoroughly, so that in low-lying spots water oozes out or opens new springs
Additional forms: Also KUR refl.-passjalkārnā

Word: jarap- "to move to and fro, march (KR-486)"
Additional forms: Also MLTjarqtreto drop, let fall

Word: collā "back wall or back side of a house"

Meaning: to drink with a noisy sucking of the lips
Additional forms: Also KURsurUkhsurUkhrnāto draw one's breath convulsively, sob.

Meaning: hair (of man or animals), bristles, mane
